Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!! IDEAL”
Reviews.Author: amy l
Reviews.Content: i travelled to Barcelona for the first time, and alone not knowing what to expect. This hotel was clean, quiet and friendly. Most importantly I could not believe how lucky I was to be perfectly located for everything. In one direction Las Ramblas, another Placa Catalunya, and spot on top of metro to get to everywhere else. If its a trip to enjoy all that Barcalona has to offer, then stay here. It is ideally located, and perfect for staying overnight, with everything you could want for breakfast to set you up for the day. oh and autobus to airport stops at top of road 2-3 mins away!! When I return in summer, I shall stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: elia r
Reviews.Content: (1) location is near the Catalonia square , and you have every thing near : metro,shopping , food, sites, etc... (2) metro is noisy (3) breakfast service is very poor, and the breakfast itself is basic, but good . (4) wifi is weak

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...everything else is average”
Reviews.Author: Lampasasite
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing..near Placa de Catalunya, minutes away from La Rambla. Other than that it's not the most memorable hotel....the rooms are very small....there's barely enough space to keep your bag besides the bed. The wash rooms are small as well. You can hear and feel vibrations every time a train passes underground. You can also hear others passing by, opening / closing doors to their rooms etc. We didn't realize that the breakfast buffet was not included in the reservation and ended up paying quite a bit for breakfast. The staff was alright....one of the managers refused to serve us drinking water during the buffet!! In summary, if you are adjusting and would trade a great location for most other amenities, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation for a city break to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Loredana_sv
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, near Placa de Catalunya. Rooms quite small, but the hotel also has big rooms, with big bathroom. Good price if booked only with accomodation, no breakfast (depends of the perriod of the year and the offer at that moment) Starbucks near hotel, mini restaurants (fast food) and bar across the street.

Reviews.Title: “La Rumbler”
Reviews.Author: Patty M
Reviews.Content: Clean and modest with an outstanding location, right above the subway, steps from Catalunya Square and La Rambla. La Rumbler refers to the subway delivering a mild earthquake every 20 minutes or so (seriously). We thought sleep would be an issue, but had the best sleep of our tour (subway stopped running around midnight). As already noted, WIFI rarely worked and the breakfast buffet not worth the cost. Staff friendly and helpful in arranging any of the multiple tours. For this price, you can't beat the location. Easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Yoav_1
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, clean and comfort. Not fancy. Good for bydget travelers. Excelenet location, just a few steps from Place de Cathalunya. Fair Breakfest. We took a double room and it was very very small, we changed at the hotel with not extra cost. Kind and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: The main reasons we picked this hotel was because of it's location, and the availability of free Wi-fi. Wi-fi wasn't working for the night we stayed, and isn't very freely available around Barcelona. There is a Starbucks almost next door, however, it's wi-fi wasn't doing too well either. On a positive note, we found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was quite spacious and clean. Our room was quite and we slept well. However, the safe was a bit small for our laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but Expect nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: BriGuyTor
Reviews.Content: Very good location which close to everywhere. 2 mins walk to Aeroshuttle station, bus to airport. Beside location don't expect anything else from this hotel. The building is on a subway line so not much they can do about it rocking the building. However the windows facing the main street don't close probably, so you can imagine the noice you will get. My wife fell to sleep right away after a long day but it took me more than an hour to get use of the noise. Bad service No smile. Don't feel welcome at all. I registered early at 9am in the morning and specifically asked for a quiet room (after reading the reviews here). They asked me to come back at 3pm. When I came back they first assigned me a room on the second level, which is no way can be quiet. I immediately requested a different room, so they gave me a room on the 8th. However when I first entered the room, it sounds like I entered the street again. I can clearly hear everything from the street. Of course I went down to the reception and request another one again. As expected, they gave me the usual Non sense, there are no other room available. The room is clean but more like an inn than a hotel. I never understand how the star rating system work. The bathroom has no hook in it. It doest worth the $200 I paid for this room. If you are only looking for location or one night stay, and used to the street noise then this is the choice. Ask for the room away from the street. I believe facing inside should be okay. See the rooms layout I posted. It will help you to pick a room.

Reviews.Title: “Despite location, choose another one”
Reviews.Author: mac_elina
Reviews.Content: I cannot say more than everything said before : exactly simialr to most of the comments. Well located but rooms are so small for an hotel in Barcelona! Nothing supplied in the bathroom, staff not wellcoming, and it seems that the hotel is also on reconstruction ! If I remember, wifi was available, which is nice. Breakfast starts at 7h30.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Average”
Reviews.Author: Azainr
Reviews.Content: The location was great and close to all places but the hotel was small and average. Dont expect an iron from the hotel if travelling on business and also the dry cleaning is expensive. The rooms were clean through. Also say no if the hotel staff at the reception offers to get you a cab to go to the airport, you might get ripped off the way I was. Its always better to get your own from the street or public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Not fit for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: hilldani
Reviews.Content: If you get a room on the first floor, don't expect to sleep -- the metro thunders by every five to ten minutes. The hardness of the bed only helps to conduct the vibration and noise. The service is exceptionally bad, even by Spanish standards. One blanket is provided for two beds, two small towels for a double room. Should you request additional linens, the reception does seem very slightly sorry that they are - claro - completely powerless to help you. (Also, I could go on about the dodgy wiring and few electrical outlets...but that's really small potatoes, in light of all the other things wrong with the place.) In service of a fair review, the ducat doesn't quite manage to fail at everything - the air conditioning does work; wifi is free and easy to use (ideal for writing up the bad review one is immediately moved to submit); the double-glazed windows keep out some noise from the street; and the bathroom is quite large (even large enough to contain several stairs, inexplicably located right by the bathtub.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cubanbreeze
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona, stayed 3 nights in the Hotel Gran Ducat. Hotel is an ideal location within walking distance to everything, however if your room is at the front you can hear all the traffic etc, so earplugs a good idea. Also the Metro runs under the Hotel so you can hear this plus feel a slight vibration. But you soon get used to it and then not notice it. Room was rather small, especially the Bathroom a bit of a squeeze getting in and out of door but not all the rooms were the same as some in our group got lucky. Breakfast was substantial and nice, enough to eat, the usual continental, fruit, cereal, pastries rolls, scrambled egg and I think it was bacon as well. Breakfast dinning area rather small, not much room in the food and drinks area. No bar or restaurant in the Hotel, small comfy seating area with TV and computer with free internet. Plus free WiFi. Would have been nice if there was Tea making facilities in the room. But plenty of Coffe Shops close by. On the whole nice Hotel friendly staff. Ideal for what we wanted just somewhere to sleep etc. as out all day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms was on third...”
Reviews.Author: gateshead38
Reviews.Content: Good location, small rooms was on third floor could hear slight rumble from metro but was not a problem. Staff were friendly and free wifi (ask reception for password).

Reviews.Title: “City centre location, tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellowferretgirl
Reviews.Content: Take the aerobus from the airport to the city centre Place de Catalunya, and the hotel is a 1 minute walk round the corner. Took the stress out of it. Room tiny and unromantic, the size of 3 double beds, and no tea and coffee making facilities, but the staff spoke great english and were very helpfull. Hotel very clean also.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ozny1
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel that it's fairly clean and location is good. Walking distance to everywhere, Plaça de Catalunya is basically at your door step. Other guests had mentioned the metro rumble and the street noise, which being from NYC didn't bother us much, what bothered us was that you can hear absolutely everything the other guests are doing, on our first morning in the hotel we woke up to someone throwing up, I swear we thought this guy was in our bathroom. The first room was on the 4th floor, so tiny as a shoe box, we asked for another room and got one on the first floor, which was slightly bigger. The staff is not very friendly, the guy that was there in the evening was ok, but an asian lady that was there during the day, was unfriendly, unhelpful and simply rude. If you need an iron, keep in mind that they only have one and they also use it in the services.. ridiculous for a 3 star hotel; also do know that if you need it, you'll have to go down to the reception desk to get it and then bring it back as soon as you are done, the lady on the reception desk actually made me go back to my room when we were on the way out, to bring it back... seriously? This hotel by no means is 3 stars, Anyway, there are so many hotels in the same area at a similar price point, that I will make sure to avoid this place on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for city trip”
Reviews.Author: BanuBas
Reviews.Content: I absolutely recommend this hotel for city trip...it is in the center, walking distance to many places and really clean. There are many opportunities around the hotel for dinner + breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “location is amazing, very cheap, clean and functional but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ernestjames
Reviews.Content: one could hear train rumbling and other hotel guests - big no-no for me, but others are probably deeper slumberers! arrived at 2am to be told by the receptionist that they were about to cancel my PREPAID booking! so make sure you ring them in advance if your running late really nasty typical Spanish cheap modernist decor - that nasty wood colour which reminds you of Sleazyjet but paid 65Eur for 1 night booked on same day online. And was in the heart of the city I love

Reviews.Title: “great location, metro rumble”
Reviews.Author: Cimjid
Reviews.Content: this is a nice little hotel that is perfectly located near Placa de Catalunya the central square, free internet, nice and clean. room was moderately small as expected in Europe and reasonable in price. starbucks on the corner, pizza shops and cafes next door, situated right between two metro stops. only thing we found annoying was the noise from the metro. it sounds like it is right below the hotel and we could hear ( not feel) the train every 15 minutes or so. It did not keep me awake but it did my husband. I would not stay on the first floor as we did. the staff was exceptionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, and value for money”
Reviews.Author: DimSpy
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location Cons: Unacceptable service, loud noise from the underliyng metro

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean and easy”
Reviews.Author: maucoccia
Reviews.Content: The good point is the location. You are 50 meter far away from Urquinaona and 150 meter from Catalunya. You can walk to Ramblas, Barrio gotico, Borne, Casas Gaudì and you can choose 3 metro lines! The room was pretty small because the big rooms were already booked. I think there are 2 different prices. Anyway the size of the room was enough for a young couple that wanted to enjoy the city. The room is clean and bathroom was good. There is wifi and a Pc in a common area. Very close to the hotel starbucks and Caffe di Roma, so you can choose vwhere have the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - that's where it ends!”
Reviews.Author: Cactusfan
Reviews.Content: The thing that you pay for with this hotel is the location. And that's it! There is no way that this hotel deserves a 3 star rating, I've stayed in better youth hostels! The first night we arrived, we were put into a shoe box room with a tiny double bed when we had booked a twin room. Then the handle came off the shower/ restroom door and my friend got locked in the bathroom. The receptionist had to get a screwdriver to jam open the door to get her out. The bed in that room was only a camp-bed and it was very uncomfortable. We got moved next day to a much bigger twin room but the bed was still very very uncomfortable. If you are just looking for somewhere to leave your suitcase then this is the hotel for you, otherwise there are cheaper hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, but the room is ok”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraDeBoston
Reviews.Content: The location was very good - right next to the Plaza Catalonia and metro that could take you anywhere. The room was disappointing, however. The first room smelled of smoke, so we asked to be given another room. It did not smell, but was tiny. At night we could hear elevator noise - not a bother for sound sleepers, but light sleepers might need ear-plugs. Overall - it is a good place for a budget traveler who wants to be close to public transportation, but do not expect it to be romantic or super comfortable. (The breakfast selection is great, but not included in the price of the room and is kind of pricey.)

Reviews.Title: “Great base to use to see Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Eagle2Stork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 10 to 14 July 2009. We arrived at the hotel at about 12:00 but were aware that we would only be let into the room at 14:00. There is a small cupboard where they let you keep your luggage so you don't have to haul it round town until you can get in to your room. Checking in was easy and the safety deposit box in the room is free. There's a refundable €20 deposit to pay but no nightly rental as in other hotels. The room was small but you don't really need much if you are using the hotel as a base to explore the city. We only paid for the room. €11 each for breakfast seemed a bit excessive and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. We had breakfast in El Corte Ingles which is opposite. (Use the lift to the 9th floor - it's a lot quicker than using the escalators.) The room was at the back of the hotel overlooking what looked like a repository for old cleaning equipment. This didn't matter because we didn't go to this hotel to stay in it all day and stare out of the window. The balcony in the room would better be described as a ledge. Just enough room to stand on - I never felt safe on it going for a smoke so I had to keep one foot in the room! The air conditioning is a bit noisy but if you have enough to drink before going to bed you don't notice it much. The bathroom was small and there was no plug in the basin. No worries about that because I always take a spare plug on holiday. The room was clean on the first day and the cleaner kept it clean - we're quite messy holidayers! You can hear/feel the Metro going under the hotel but this is not really worth mentioning. It is not irritating and you have to realise that Barcelona is a vibrant city and not some back of beyond little hamlet. Plaza Catalunya is only a stone's throw away. If you get the tourist bus, get a 2 day pass for €27 instead of the 1 day pass for €21. We used the bus to see where we wanted to go on the first day and then on the second day used the bus to get to the places we decided we wanted to go to. Remember to use the discounts in the booklet that you get when you board the bus! Some of them aren't much but a couple of them are for 2 meals for one. La Rambla is busy and there is plenty to see. Keep an eye on your valuables though because the thieves are rife! I thought one little old beggar lady was quite harmless until I felt her fingers in my jeans - she only got a street map and gave it back in disgust! The nighttime entertainment outside the Zurich Cafe (Plaza Catalunya) is a must. The chap who apes the passers by is very funny and it's a good laugh watching the street sellers scarper when the police arrive. Checking out of the hotel was simple because the computer had broken down. Not sure what it would be like if the computer was working. All in all we had a good time here because we only used the hotel as a base for seeing the city. We would definitely return to this hotel if visiting Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location but there is endless noise”
Reviews.Author: UKBandido
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location - close to the bus turistic, to the aerobus stop (placa catalunya), passeig de gracia and close to la rambla and any shops if you need anything. That's one of the very few plus points (the others are that the chambermaid does a very good job and that they have at least 1 english channel on tv even though it's not enough but then again, it's not an English country)... The size of my room was very small (I guess the large mirror was there to create the illusion of space - it didn't work), the lights were left on for my arrival making it appear to be a 'bright' room during the daytime. Well, if you turn the lights off, the room is almost pitch black...and the view out of the window? well, it's onto other windows and if you're unlucky enough to have a room like mine and you look down, you'll also notice cigarette butts, mops etc. (check my pictures). They really need to sort out the problem with light in the rooms (artificial light is not enough). I really think that some of these rooms should be storage rooms and not actualy bedrooms. Otherwise I think the hotel should knock two rooms out to make 1 whole room. The final point is probably the biggest issue I had with the room and it was a noise issue. Now, I have no idea what the two separate sounds were. One of them sounds like a generator which would make this kind of humming sound and that occured occasionally. The other was a sound which would occur about every 15 minutes - it sounded like a cross between a thunderstorm and an earthquake (this is not hyperbole either). Someone else who reviewed the hotel said this noise did not occur at night - well that's wrong because it absolutely did. Maybe they're just very good sleepers. I hardly slept at all. I would say that if you only intend to spend a few hours in your room and you can sleep through a thunderstorm, an earthquake and the sound of war then it's fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, clean, but very small”
Reviews.Author: dimplex99
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night after our cruise. Normally, we are not 5-star hotel types, but even this was small according to our standards. We chose this hotel b/c it was cheap. We wanted a great location, but something we'd go back to sleep and shower at night. That's all this hotel really was. We were lucky enough to get a balcony room though. If you are looking for a great location in the middle of everything get this hotel. Buses and train run near the plaza. Great shopping and restaurants in walking distance. They do serve a paid breakfast, but it's a joke. Don't pay for their crusty food when you walk downstairs and there's plenty of nice eateries nearby. Pros: Excellent location in the middle of everything Rooms were very clean Free Internet access via a small terminal in their lounge Staff was semi-helpful and semi-friendly There was a luggage storage available if you can't check-in yet Cons: Rooms smelled of thick cigarette smoke Tiny bathroom almost a joke No clocks available in the room No wake up call when I specifically asked for one TV was tiny and dated Overall, it is good value for your money, if you only need a place to sleep and shower at night. Not exactly a 3-star resort even.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 for location...... pity about the view”
Reviews.Author: onthespot
Reviews.Content: Liked Great Location, almost on top of Placa Catalunya Hotel Clean Room was mid size plenty of space Breakfast (inculded in price) self service , was good enough even for even fussy eaters. cereal, sweet breads, cold meats or fruit. or even scrambled eggs, bacon, bean. Not Liked Short bed No view just overlooked other room windows the odd rumble from the merto, (but it does stop running during the night) Booked on line via the hotels own web site, took airport bus from BCN, cost less than 5 euros single fare...bus route ends less than 4 minute walk fron Hotel front door, at Placa Catalunya, this is the transport super hub and the square the locals regard as home. Over all would I go again YES Value for money 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DeeStourbridge
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at a very reasonable rate. The location is fantastic. The room was quite basic and small but clean. We had a double bed which as pushed up against the wall, not ideal. Staff were very friendly. Ideal location if not spending much time in the room and want a base to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it was”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a little Eurpoean vacation with a friend. If you're in Barcelona there's plenty to do, so there's no need to spend too much time in the hotel room. Everything was good, not great. The location is convenient too mass transit, easy to get to from the airport, and close enough on foot to the old city - the main tourist destination. Other tourist destinations were easily accesable by Barcelona's excellent subway. The room was clean, the shower was fine, and everything seemed safe. The service was competent if not exceptionally polite. Everyone spoke English, which was nice. You're definitely not paying for frills. The price wasn't great, but I did some searching, and I think that's just the nature of Barcelona. Also, the TV was horrible and barely worked.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - very good location”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerLDN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic but has a great location right by Placa Catalunya which is it's strongest point I'd say. The rooms are basic but clean and sheets changed each day. Bathroom is alright, clean. The staff were friendly and was good to see that when I returned after checking out but had left my Blackberry in the room it was kept safe for me. Overall, does the trick as a cheap base in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Central and practical”
Reviews.Author: RPB88
Reviews.Content: Positive: - Staff were friendly and helpful - Free Wireless Internet available in the rooms - Room was spacious (although not necessarily pretty) - Large spacious bathroom with bathtub - City Centre location with many supermarkets and shops - Close to the Metro (<5min) Negative: - Double bed consists of 2 single beds pushed together - Tiny TV with a very bad reception and sound quality in the rooms - The safe didn’t work in the room (no key) - No restuarant in this hotel, but there are many in the surrounding streets - There was a hole in the wall (up high) between our bathroom and the neighbors bathroom, so you could hear nextdoor (and visa-versa) - Elevators are nice after a long hot day, but don't count on the elevators being operational, as only 1 (of 2) elevator was operational during our stay and it broke down for a day! - Also remember that you will be charged 7% IVA on room price (= internet price) when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well clear-absolutely AWFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: Irishairyfairy
Reviews.Content: This was without doubt the worst place i have ever stayed. First problem was the check in procedure. The man on reception was the most inefficient person i have ever seen-it was like a scene out of Fawlty Towers-he is the real life Manuel!! We were basically ignored for half an hour and when he would start checking me in he would then tell me to move out of the way when two couples came to check out. Next problem was the room itself, we had a room on the first floor though i had requested a room on the lower levels. The room was tiny and very depresing. Also it sounded like an earthquake every 5 minutes when the metro underneath passed by, the windows would literally shake-it was unbelieveable. I didnt try move rooms because after the trouble we had checking in i just couldnt face him again. Next problem -in the bathroom leading down from the bath were two steps on a really shiny tiled floor-no grip whatsoever. After having a shower my boyfriend slipped on this floor and fell down the two steps and really hurt his back on the steps. He was in a lot of pain for the rest of the trip and still has bruising as a reminder. I never had breakfast in the hotel-my reason was that i refused to pay them any more money than i already had. There was a little 'snack shop' that was supposed to open from7-7. I only seen it open once for about an hour. We bought a bottle of water from this shop but the girl on the counter couldnt speak english AT ALL and we resorted to doing gestures to tell her we were looking for a drink!! I would never recommend anyone stay here. It has a great location but it really was a miserable excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking Scam”
Reviews.Author: lajoa
Reviews.Content: I booked 1 night stay via Expedia and received a confirmation via email. Upon arrival and check-in on Saturday 16-Aug the front-desk staff gave me some story about how their plumbing was broken for the weekend. I don't buy their story and I just think they overbooked. I speak fluent Spanish and I gave them a hard time for about 30 minutes full of their apologies and they stuck to the "no hot water, plumbing" story. They claim they went thru lots of trouble trying to find us another hotel (I'm sure it was trouble as August in Spain is a busy tourist month) and they had it all set up for us to go to Eurostars Mitre hotel and even called a taxi to pick us up. The Eurostars Mitre was about 3-4 train stops from the city center and I was not happy as we paid for city center price. We incurred additional expenses buying train passes because of this. The only reason I picked Gran Ducat is because it is right off Plaza Catalunya. For moving us to Mitre hotel they didn't offer to comp us breakfast or any upgrade and I think the hotel we were sent to was lesser quality although it is hard to compare since I never got to stay at Gran Ducat. During their explaining and them trying to answer all the questions I had about transportation to/from city center I saw other hotel guests walking in and out of the Gran Ducat. Also to further confirm my suspicion I asked the taxi driver about how often this happens and how many guests he has been called for transfer (once again my Spanish came in handy) and he said several hotels had funny business going on. I think they overbooked and because we only booked 1 night they decided to bump us to another hotel versus others who might have been staying there the entire weekend. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone and I am currently awaiting a response from Expedia about this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location 1/2 block from Placa Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: bbeerbower
Reviews.Content: pros: EXCELLENT LOCATION! ½ block from Placa Catalunya (top of Las Ramblas) within walking distance of major attractions; metro stop: aeroport bus stop; hop on hop off bus; tourist information office; supermarket (Ingles) similar to Wal-Mart English speaking friendly, helpful staff; Clean hotel; comfortable beds; Free computer center; Wi-Fi; breakfast (11 euros) other options within same block. Free roomsafe. complimentary water in lobby a nice plus when you return from exploring Barcelona. cons: Hotel is noisy @ night because people stay up all night & are very loud returning to their rooms. there is no carpet throughout hotel thus sound travels. metro runs under the hotel during the day but stops running around 1pm. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again for it's location & helpful, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Three (flickering) stars”
Reviews.Author: dominus_matthaeus
Reviews.Content: The Gran Ducat's location is truly excellent, and in this I agree with other reviewers. That said, I'm not sure it lives up to the luxury one expects from other contenders in the 3-star category such as Ibis or Travelodge. I arrived in Barcelona early in the morning so being able to leave my bag in the hotel's locker was a definite plus; but at 4 in the afternoon my room STILL was not ready. Once I finally made it in and was at last able to take off my suit, a maid entered the room after only the most cursory of knocks. The room itself was very small and interior, though that may have been a blessing given others' comments on the noise. The shade was missing off one of the bedside lamps and the telly had been completely detuned, not a single channel was available. The room rattled regularly due to the rather shallow tube tunnel underneath the building. If your means of booking allows it, skip the breakfast - there's loads of cafés nearby open early, and there's also a supermarket in the Corte Inglés store across the street if you'd rather prepare breakfast in bed for yourself. All in all, adequate value for money - just.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: miromar
Reviews.Content: Th elocation of the hotel is superb, as it is close to all the amenities and sights. The hotel itself is basic, but very clean and new. The room was small, but the bed was comfy and the bathroom was big enough. Breakfast was basic too, but as it is included couldnt complaint too much about it!!! By far the best feature of this hotel is the location!

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff, Clean, but Loud”
Reviews.Author: COtrips
Reviews.Content: This is a true 3-star hotel in Barcelona. It is in a great location, in the city center, next to the Renfe & Metro stops. We were able to walk to all the city sites, and when needed, it was quite easy to get on the trains to go south. We were able to check in really early on the day we arrived, and the rest of our stay the staff has been superior to many US Hotels. The hotel is clean and it seems the maids are cleaning from morning to sunset. This is where some of the negatives come in: This hotel is VERY noisy...and it may be because the hotel is built around an atrium so sound travels well. Its not outside noise, but the cleaning staff slamming doors at all hours, and in the morning, the elevators can be heard when it starts getting busy. The building has a rumble to it when the subways pass under. Have noise cancelling headphones? bring em! That being said, the staff at the front desk, is awesome. They switched us to a slightly larger room which we hoped was quieter, but it wasn´t. Still, a nice budget hotel at around $110USD/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and parents for five nights. It was a nice basic hotel but with no restaurant/bar as such. Breakfast is served in a small cafe/shop style room. The rooms are small but clean and functional.Excellent location and friendly staff . It is located on a busy road so noise levels can be high but if you are 3rd floor or above its fine. It makes for a nice budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Powerjh
Reviews.Content: Really good deal on the website but wasnt expecting much when I got to the hotel for the price we were charged. What we got was a good standard hotel with pleasant staff and amazing location. We couldnt have gotten any more central than we did. Great location, right beside everything. barcelonas got a superb infrastructure so if you are only here for a city break get to this hotel, not the most beautiful but perfect for short stays

Reviews.Title: “Price was GOOD, noise was NOT.”
Reviews.Author: katgrace
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early, so we had to stow our bags for a while.... the front desk lady was somewhat helpful but it seemed more like we were bothering her than anything. We asked for a good place to eat breakfast and she looked at us an said that there was a Starbucks on the corner. Sorry but I am not going all of the way to Spain to go to a Starbucks... so we found a good tapas place a few buildings over for breakfast (it was wonderful!!!! I will review that later). We found that the location of the hotel is great. The neighborhood is nice, has great shopping and the metro is right there. When we finally did get our room we found it to be a bit cozy. Some reviewers find it small and cramped, but if you are a traveler then most likely what you want is a bed and a bathroom... so we were fine with the size. However when we finally did go to sleep we found that we could hear the elevator screeching.... and everyone walking up and down the hallways. The fact that there is tile everywhere is very elegant and easy to clean but it is LOUD as heck!!! I truly believe there is no insulation in the walls, I thought someone was in our bathroom while we were sleeping, but it turned out to be the people across the hall running their water. The point of this review is to state that #1 it is LOUD #2 the help is a hit or a miss and #3 it is LOUD. If they worked on the noise issue... I might go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all bad”
Reviews.Author: Gasman295
Reviews.Content: The room we were allocated on arrival was not very good we asked to be moved but the hotel was full , but we were given another the next day which was much better . the breakfast was good with a very wide choice , including cereals cold meats and cheeses , bacon scrambled eggs , fruit salad , and cakes .And as much coffee as you wanted. The location couldn't have been better , just around the corner from Placa Catalonia , which is where the bus from the airport drops you off . There was a coffee bar in the hotel but we did not use it as we were not in the hotel for to much time. The staff were really helpful and pointed us in the right direction a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a city break!!”
Reviews.Author: superayrfan
Reviews.Content: I had read other peoples reviews on the trip advisor site before I travelled to The Hotel Gran Ducat and was pleased that the highest percentage were positive but was slightly concerned at the nature of the the negative reviews eg noisy hotel, tiny rooms etc My wife and I flew from Prestwick to Girona Airport then caught a coach from the airport to Barcelona bus station. On arrival we jumped into one of the many , many taxis available outside the bus station for a 5 minute trip to our hotel. The taxi driver had slight difficulty in finding the hotel as he had not been to it previously.....maybe due to the fact that there are in excess of 3000 hotels in the city. On arrival at the hotel's tiny entrance we were welcomed by a very friendly young man on reception duty. He had us checked in after a few minutes and directed us to our rooms on the 4th floor of the hotel via one of the 2 lifts available. On reaching the room I opened the door with the electronic keycard and must say I was a bit suprised at how compact the room was. My wife and I had a bit of a laugh about it and entered the room to check it out further. It may have been compact but it was spotlessly clean and had nice fluffy white towels, hot power shower ( in fact very hot water!) and crisp clean bedding. We were only using the room for sleeping in ( or maybe some extra cirricular activities that married couples with kids have when they escape children free for a few days!) so because the room wasn't the size of a pop star's suite we weren't too bothered. Due to the fact that we'd arrived early evening and were quite hungry and didn't know our way around the city I asked the reception staff for a recommendation for a meal and he very curteously gave me a card for a nearby establishment where we had a lovely meal and glass of wine at very reasonable prices. The first night in the hotel did concern me slightly due to the noise of one inconsiderate female on the same floor as us who insisted on knocking very loudly on the door of the room she was sharing with her husband / boyfriend at 3am to gain entry after returning to the hotel a bit worse for wear. If I had been able to get my head off the pillow I might have knocked very loudly on her head but fortunately I was too tired to get myself into trouble with our new neighbours!! There was a bit of traffic noise at night and then around 7 / 8 am again but it is smack in the middle of a major city centre and the advantages of the location far outweighed the disadvantages that I encountered. The following morning we left the hotel and went to one of the many eatieries close at hand for breakfast, coffee and a spot of people watching in the warm Catalanyan sunshine....easily 70 degrees in October. Just lovely. I am reviewing the hotel but I must put in a good word for the city itself. It is one of the most breathtaking cities I have ever been in with regards to architecture and impressive buildings, history etc. I went to Barcelona as a bit of a ignoramous regarding culture and decorum but spent most of 2 days on the excellent open top bus tours which took us around some of the most beautiful sights , buildings , points of interest I have ever witnessed. Stunning place....I recommend to anyone! As a mad footy fan the best bit for me was the trip to the Nou Camp stadium , home of the mighty Barcelona FC but there were plenty of other more " cultured" sites to visit in addition. Grab the red bus line and the blue bus line for the trip of a lifetime ....well worth the 23 euros each for 2 days of trips, Eat in the Hard Rock Cafe in the Catalanyan Square for the biggest portions in Barca but do also try the many traditional Tapas Bars in the area. Drink San Miguel but also experience a " mohito" which is a mix of rum, mint, lime and some other goodies served in a glass with crushed ice and a straw! Fantastic!! Hit the shops and do a bit of damage to your credit card , the stores sell real nice quality goods. Have no concerns about using the Hotel Gran Ducat as a base if you are in Barcelona for a short city break. The rooms were cleaned daily whether they needed it or not, we had fresh towels every day and the bedlinen was changed twice over a 4 day stay. Some hotels will be roomier and more luxurious but the location won't be as fit for the purpose as the Gran Ducat and in addition the tariff I paid for a 3 night stay in a leading European City was very reasonable. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful during our stay even to the extent that after we checked out they agreed to hold our luggage until later in the day and even pre ordered us a taxi to take us back to the bus station to catch our transfer to the airport. Don't listen to the moaners in some reviews....use the hotel for what it is good for and take the opportunity to enjoy a beautiful city right on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: ArielaBA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gran Ducat is one block away from Plaza Catalunya which makes it really close to everything else, you'll be within a walkng distance to Casa Guell, the Rambla, the great neighbourhood of The Born etc... The Hotel has a very small entrance with almost no space for a lobby, the breakfast was ok, and the room we stayied in very modern. The daylight receptionist was very kind, spoke perfect english but confusing spanish, wich wasn't a problem to me but it was to my mother and grandmother who don't speak english and had trouble communicating with her. (I think it's great to have a prefect English but as it is Spain we're visiting, Spanish shouldn't be a problem...) Overall I recommend this place to those seeking for a great location and modern standard rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Ducat”
Reviews.Author: cockatoo
Reviews.Content: the hotel gran ducat is centrally located, just around the corner from the plac de catulunya which is the central meeting place and where there are great transport links from. the aerobus from the airport stops here as well. the hotel do a great breakfast menu with the most delicious bacon i have tasted abroad in a long time, the scrambled eggs could be better but apart from that you have a great choice from the buffet style breakfast room which starts at 7.30 till 11am so you can have a lie in as well. the bedrooms are clean, lovely fluffy white towels, air conditioned, have both bath and shower, have a a tv and lovely comfy bed. if you want a drink in your room take a travel kettle and mugs as there are none supplied. the staff are very friendly and will supply tourist maps if you ask. the rambles is a short walk around the corner, pass the department store engaise and across the public square which has two beautiful fountains.

Reviews.Title: “What is everyone moaning about?”
Reviews.Author: nseaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my first visit to Barcelona. The location is superb. You cant get a better location. The hotel was clean and tidy. Basic but fairly modern. It was so good im going back in August Book this hotel if you want a hassle free stay in Barcelona It was fine ! Ignore the Moaning. This hotel was great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Look let the hotel spoil your holiday”
Reviews.Author: magyar_lany
Reviews.Content: First of all the positive points: The location is very central, opposite of the "El Corte Ingles" at the Praca Catalunya. Secondly, the room was clean. But that doesn't mean, that it was kind of renovated or else....one of the negative points was that the room was "lived down", lots dirty slings and cracks in the wall. No surprise actually the metro seems to rumble along just under the hotel, funny thing however that we could hear the rumbling every few minutes even in the 3rd floor. A very good example for the noise in the hotel. You heard just everything everytime. Day and night. And we didn't have a room with a window facing the street....actually only very few rooms in that house have that. After a look on the floor-room-map: The most rooms are grouped around some indoor space. Don't expect to get any sunlight, fresh air or any idea on the outside weather conditions !! You can just see the opposite wall and if you're lucky, the naked guests in the room opposite to yours ;o)) This hole didn't kill our sense of humour, but it worked very hard on it, really !! The room we where given consisted actually only of one bed, as you can see on the photos. No space to walk, just the bed. Open the door and jump into your bed ! Furthermore the room was a single room and the bed (140 x 200 cm) far too small for 2 persons. But of course we had to pay a double-room. When we complained about this no-one seemed to be interested. Other signs that the room is a single was the single chair in the room and only one available keycard for the door. Don't book in that hotel, because if you get a so called special tourist offer, you will end up in a single room with 2 persons and paying far too much for that. And don't book there neither, because if you have to pay for a double room, the rates will be far to high for that dump. And the other rooms on the map looked also very small. (no windows !!!) Simply overpriced old worn down place. I was just do dissapointed. Due to the small bed and the lack of any fresh air we couldn't hardly get sleep and it was a depressing time. The cupboard included a safe. When checking in, of course the guy didn't inform us about the opportunity to b"borrow" a key for a deposit of 10 Euro. We had to go up to the room, to see that the safe was closed, go down again to ask about the situation and then, surprise surprise, we got the information. One really good joke was, that the 10 Euro deposit was put in an separatedly sealed envelope with our room number and put in a box. On departure however we received the deposit via 2 x 5-Euro notes from an non-sealed envelope...haha...so what all the fuss about that sealing and envelope ?!?!!! Just ridiculous. In the end we didn't care any more about the unfriendly reception guy, he was completely ignoring the people. One evening there was a fire alarm, everyone was rushing downwards and asking around. After 15 guests were standing around and asking him, he said "Ok, seems to be in the 6th floor, maybe I will go and have a look". Hello ?!?!?!!! Complete waste of money that guy. On departure day I noticed that the cleaning woman must have taken away a white t-shirt from me when changing the linen. Of course, no one at the reception was interested, I don't expect to get it back by post. The note I handed them out, was put aside. I have never been in a place with that unfriendly staff and such a non-interested attitude. Don't make the same mistake as we did !! Don't book there !! There should be other affordable places in the city. We will visit Barcelona again, but we will look for another place to sleep for sure !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: nescafequeen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights 20-23 May 2007. The location is fantastic - literally less than 30 seconds from Plaza Cataluña and La Rambla where you can find tons of restaurants and shops. The only down side is that the hotel was a little noisy as the Metro line runs directly underneath it but this really wasn't a problem when you are very tired and can sleep forever! The rooms were a little small but clean and modern, a powerful shower, fresh towels every day and air conditioning which was a godsend in the summer heat!! If you fancy a cheap meal one night, try a restaurant nearby the hotel called 'El Raco'. When you leave the hotel turn left and the restaurant is across the square. Because it's just off the main strip, we found the prices to be reasonable. There's also a small corner shop along there selling snacks, drinks, alcohol etc which is nearer than the supermarket on La Rambla. All in all, a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - literally 3 minutes from the square”
Reviews.Author: janeds
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my husband for 4 days. Having read some unfavourable reviews I was a little apprehensive but found the exact opposite. The room was large and very clean and light. Breakfast was good and the staff very friendly and helpful. Superb location - on doorstep practically for the square and La Ramblas.The department store El Corte Ingles is on the corner of the square and the hotel's street. Would certainly stay here again. The aeroport bus drops and picks up at the square every 12 mins.and the metro station is in the square too. Fabulous city - loads to see and do. Apart from the magnificent Sagrada Familia and Gaudi's other wonders there is so much to see in Barcelona. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour of Barcelona's football stadium for something different and the bus tour is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nella7
Reviews.Content: My two friends & I stayed at this hotel in Barcelona, which is a lovely city to explore. The hotel was very central, clean with the usual buffet breakfast. However I booked this through an agency & asked for three single beds we actually got 2 beds with an ancient well used put-u-up. Fortunately one friend is small & slightly built & she agreed to 'manage' as she didn't want to make a fuss. We paid full price for inhferior sleeping arrangements. Just be aware if you need a third bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Gran Job!!”
Reviews.Author: jerrywasthere
Reviews.Content: The Gran Ducat Hotel was fantastic. My brother and i visited Barcelona for the first time for a two night break taking advantage of the low cost airline revolution to enjoy the sights, the local brew and of course the mighty barca barca barca football team. We found the Gran Ducat no problem. A two minute walk after a 15 minute journey on the aerobus from the airport. The location was perfect. 150 yards from the placa catalunya and the ramblas. 50 yards from the metro aswell as pubs,cafes and shops on your doorstep. The hotel itself and the rooms were immaculately clean and tidy. The rooms were comfortable although quite basic but more than adequte for our stay as most of the time we spent out and about. Although i can't comment much on breakfast (too much estrella!!), there was plenty of juice, toast, tea, coffe and pastries etc on offer. Dining and drinking highlights were the H3 bar where we enjoyed the local brew and tapas. Very much a locals bar which was fab! Visit the ramblas by all means but be aware that its quite tacky and the pubs are ridiculously overpriced tourist traps. A personal highlight and must for music fans and cheap booze is the manchester bar. Tell barman Jerry we sent ya! Legend! Barcelona is a beautiful friendly city and its safe to say we''ll be back!!!!!!!! Barca! Barca! Barca!

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy and small”
Reviews.Author: Natology
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and is clean but... The room we stayed in was tiny, not fit for 2 people and it is very noisy. The floors are all tiles which is perfect for cleaning but it means you hear everything from the halls and the rooms next to you. It cost us €90 a night, and I would not consider it good value. I would describe it as a good 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dedders
Reviews.Content: 25 girls from work went to Barcelona for 2 nights. The location of the hotel was superb, for a short stay it was fantastic to have all the major sites within walking distance. The hotel was spotless and breakfast was more than adequate. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Barcelona. Other reviews said that rooms were noisy and small. The room I had was on the main street and quite large, however ,some of the inner rooms are quite small. This was not a problem, particularly as most of the time was spent out and about. Also the hotel is very conveniant for the aerobus, only a 2 minute walk from the place de catalunya, a major square with bus and underground transport links. For Tapas I would recommend Cocina Vasca on Placa Nova 3, near the cathedral. The best Tapas we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Close to the Ramblas, you cannot be more central located in the city than in this hotel. The hotel itself is nice and new. The only disadvantage are the walls which are a bit thin. But for us, this was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fiona024
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, breakfast was a bit of a bun fight when the hotel was full - the staff tried really hard to be helpful and were very sympathetic to our poor Spanish. Got there via the aerobus (2nd stop C.de Catyluna) the hotel is just across the road. Brilliant position for the sights, restaurant isn't open at night, but there is no shortage of very good restaurants. Great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: skiva
Reviews.Content: The hotel Gran Ducat was lovely, well priced and located. The room was clean and we even had a nice balcony. We were located on the 5th floor, but that was fine as there was a lift :) The staff were quite friendly and informative too. The other bonus with regards to Gran Ducat, is the free internet access, which proved to be rather handy! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, we found it on the internet and were quite pleasantly surprised :)
